entry.value: # Copy input to output%%00010output_table = input_table.copy()%%00010from sklearn.metrics import roc_curve, auc%%00010from sklearn import datasets%%00010from sklearn.multiclass import OneVsRestClassifier%%00010from sklearn.svm import LinearSVC%%00010from sklearn.preprocessing import label_binarize%%00010import matplotlib.pyplot as plt%%00010import pandas as pd%%00010%%00010df = pd.DataFrame(data=output_table)%%00010%%00010y_true = label_binarize(df['Output'], classes=['active','inactive','indeterminate'])%%00010y_predicted = label_binarize(df['Prediction (Output)'], classes=['active','inactive','indeterminate'])%%00010n_classes = 3%%00010%%00010#print(y_true[0:3])%%00010# Compute ROC curve and ROC area for each class%%00010fpr = dict()%%00010tpr = dict()%%00010roc_auc = dict()%%00010for i in range(n_classes):%%00010 fpr[i], tpr[i], _ = roc_curve(y_true[:, i], y_predicted[:, i])%%00010 roc_auc[i] = auc(fpr[i], tpr[i])%%00010%%00010# Plot of a ROC curve for a specific class%%00010for i in range(n_classes):%%00010 plt.figure()%%00010 plt.plot(fpr[i], tpr[i], label='ROC curve (area = %0.2f)' % roc_auc[i])%%00010 plt.plot([0, 1], [0, 1], 'k--')%%00010 plt.xlim([0.0, 1.0])%%00010 plt.ylim([0.0, 1.05])%%00010 plt.xlabel('False Positive Rate')%%00010 plt.ylabel('True Positive Rate')%%00010 plt.title('Receiver operating characteristic example')%%00010 plt.legend(loc="lower right")%%00010 plt.show()%%00010%%00010output_table
